verses.text: Except the \sc Lord\sc* build the house, they labour in vain that build it: Except the \sc Lord\sc* keep the city, the watchman waketh \add but\add* in vain.
\add It is\add* vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, To eat the bread of sorrows: \add For\add* so he giveth his beloved sleep.
Lo, children \add are\add* an heritage of the \sc Lord\sc*: \add And\add* the fruit of the womb \add is his\add* reward.
As arrows \add are\add* in the hand of a mighty \add man;\add* So \add are\add* children of the youth.
Happy \add is\add* the man that hath his quiver full of them: They shall not be ashamed, But they shall speak with the enemies in the gate.
